result.execSummary:
The defendant Mauricio "nmi" Ortiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and stayed with 0 days credit.
Imposed/stayed.  In the event of revocation, conditions of extended supervision to be the same as those in 11CF53 and 11CF54.

OWI 6th.  

Probation to be consecutive to any sentence defendant is serving, with the following conditions:

6 months county jail time.

No possession/consumption of alcohol or entry into taverns.  No possession/consumption of any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine at demand of law enforcement/agent to monitor compliance.

Pay fine plus costs including the DNA surcharge.

Submit to AODA and follow through with recommendations.  Driver Safety Plan to be relicensed.

Seek/maintain regular employment.

Follow through on any counseling or educational programs.
Consecutive to: any sentence Defendant is already serving

for Half-Priced Ignition Interlock Device (IID)
Associated with Charge #1
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Mauricio "nmi" Ortiz in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA states that the parties have an agreement for resolution; def will be waiving his right to prelim and proceeding with the recommended 6 years prison with 3 initial confinement and 3 ext. supervision imposed/stayed for probation of 3 years with 6 mo jail as condition; $600 fine; 36 mo IID; 36 mo dl revocation; assessment/follow through; probation to be consecutive to previous sentence; 0 days credit.  Conditions of probation to be the same as those ordered last week as conditions of extended supervision in 11CF53 and 11CF54.

Def waives his right to a prelim.  Court's colloquy with def re prelim waiver.

Def pleads guilty.  Court's colloquy re plea.  Finding of guilty.

Sentence:  OWI 6th.  6 year prison with 3 years initial confinement and 3 years ext. supervision, imposed and stayed for 3 years probation consecutive to any sentence serving.  Conditions:  6 mo county jail, 36 mo revocation, 36 mo IID upon relicensing, no possession/consumption of alcohol or entry into taverns, not to possess/consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription, submit to testing of blood, breath or urine at demand of law enf. to check compliance; $600 fine plus costs; AODA/driver safety plan; seek/maintain regular employment; follow through on any counseling or educational programs; DNA surcharge as part of the costs.  Firearm and other felony admonishments provided.
Sentencing hearing at 08-03-2015 04:00 pm
request from Atty. Martinez to schedule sentencing Monday afternoon, August 3rd before Def is taken to prison on Tuesday

Attorney Andrew I. Martinez in court with Defendant Mauricio "nmi" Ortiz. Prosecuting Atty Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Harper asks court for this matter to be reset for status or possible Plea.  Adjourned for status proceedings scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Mauricio "nmi" Ortiz in court, in custody, with attorney Andrew I. Martinez. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defense waives formal reading of the complaint. Court informs def of the charges/max possible penalties. Defense will waive time limits for prelim. Court accepts waiver of time periods. Defense requests status.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.
letter from Atty. Andrew Martinez - will be representing def but cannot appear at the time set for the initial; request adj. to April 17 at 10
written minutes - bond set at $5000 cash with no drink and test on demand conditions as well as no tavern entry
